title: Chinese PR and Digital Marketing Manager
description:
Who we are – a UK’s Leading China and HK Property and Luxury PR Agency 


Founded in 2015 by Founder and Managing Director Sally Maier-Yip, 11K Consulting is a UK’s leading China-focused Luxury & Property PR & Communications boutique agency, specialised in real estate, design, architecture, luxury, and more.


Our vision is to transform 11,000km distance between UK and China/Asia into bridges through the power of effective communications. We are a team of modern, multi-lingual, communications experts who help European clients reach and influence Chinese/Asian investors, HNWIs, luxury consumers and travellers.


Our clients are a mix of luxury property developer, interior design, architecture, construction, furniture, and luxury lifestyle companies.


We are growing fast and are now seeking a strong full-time Chinese PR and digital marketing manager who will be committed to grow with the company and add value to our existing offerings to clients.


http://11kconsulting.com


Responsibilities: 
Be the trusted primary point of contact for our clients and strategic business and agency partnersCampaign creation and daily management of all PR communications, with good quality of work and meeting expected outcomesAble to create quality PR and social media content in both Chinese and English – e.g. Chinese press releases, brochures, website content; articles and posts for Chinese social media such as WeChat, Weibo and Little Red Book, etc.Lead and manage clients’ social media channels – from content marketing strategy, writing and designing the articles, generating targeted views to reportingManage and execute events for clientsManage internal teams in the UK and China; and business and agency partnersAssist with PR activities for 11K – e.g. writing blogs, social media posts, events, etc.Be willing to network regularly and help expand company’s strategic partnership networks in the UK, China and/or HK

About You 


Native Mandarin Chinese speaker ONLY and fluent in EnglishProven experience in a similar role with at least 4 years’ experienceExceptional writing, editing and presentation skills in both Chinese and English – a mustStrong commercial awareness, with a passion for luxury and propertyStrong business ethics and networkAble to work independentlyA proactive, self-motivated, reliable and responsible approachA keen networker and learnerGood team player

Location 
·       Central London
·       Hybrid working with two days a week in the office is standard


Language:
·       Native in Mandarin and fluent in English


Benefits:
·       Competitive salary: £30,000 - £35,000pa
·       Starting salary is subject to experience
·       Annual bonus subject to the employee’s performance and company’s financial performance
·       25 days holiday plus a day off on your birthday
·       Attractive bonus system for winning new clients
·       Receive regular training (both in-house and external)
·       Great networking opportunities to meet with influential and senior people in the UK
